attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Wide Laser
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Corphish.

attacks.name: Iron Head
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Carvanha does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Super Hypno Wave
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Rare Candy
text: Choose 1 of your Basic Pokémon in play. If you have a Stage 1 or Stage 2 card that evolves from that Pokémon in your hand, put that card on the Basic Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.)

cards.name: Mysterious Fossil
text: Play Mysterious Fossil as if it were a Basic Pokémon. While in play, Mysterious Fossil counts as a Colorless Pokémon (as well as a Trainer card). Mysterious Fossil has no attacks of its own, can't retreat, and can't be affected by any Special Conditions. If Mysterious Fossil is Knocked Out, it doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon. (Discard it anyway.) At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Mysterious Fossil from play.

cards.name: Professor Cozmo's Discovery
text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Flip a coin. If heads, draw the bottom 3 cards of your deck. If tails, draw the top 2 cards of your deck.

ability.name: Delta Reactor
ability.text: As long as any Stadium card with Holon in its name is in play, each of your Pokémon that has δ on its card does 10 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

ability.name: Clear Body
ability.text: Regice can't be affected by any Special Conditions.

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

ability.name: Fellowship
ability.text: Bellossom can use the attacks of all Oddish, Gloom, Vileplume, Vileplume ex, or other Bellossom you have in play as its own. (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.)

attacks.name: Aqua Flower
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, Bellossom has no Weakness.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Mr. Stone's Project
text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.

Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. Or, search your discard pile for up to 2 basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand.

cards.name: Dark Metal Energy
text: Attach Dark Metal Energy to 1 of your Pokémon. While in play, Dark Metal Energy provides Darkness and Metal Energy, but provides only 1 Energy at a time. (Doesn't count as a basic energy card when not in play and has no effect other than providing Energy.)

attacks.name: Delta Edge
attacks.text: If you have any Supporter cards in play, this attack's base damage is 20 instead of 70.

attacks.name: Fossil Charge
attacks.text: You may discard a Claw Fossil, Mysterious Fossil, Root Fossil, or Holon Fossil from your hand. If you do, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and do 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Harsh Fluid
attacks.text: Put 5 damage counters on the Defending Pokémon at the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Poison Tentacles
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

ability.name: Dual Aura
ability.text: As long as you have Latios or Latios ex in play, each player's Evolved Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex) can't use any Poké-Bodies.

attacks.name: Spearhead
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Foresight
attacks.text: Look at the top 5 cards of either player's deck and put them back on top of that player's deck in any order.

attacks.name: Overrun
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Rayquaza.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy attached to Rayquaza.

attacks.name: Poison Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Fury Cutter
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If 1 of them is heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage. If 2 of them are heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage. If all of them are heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Super Singe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Acid
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Pebble Hurl
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Eerie Light
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Water Arrow
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Root Fossil
text: Play Root Fossil as if it were a Basic Pokémon. While in play, Root Fossil counts as a Colorless Pokémon (as well as a Trainer card). Root Fossil has no attacks of its own, can't retreat, and can't be affected by any Special Conditions. If Root Fossil is Knocked Out, it doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon. (Discard it anyway.) At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Root Fossil from play.
At any time between turns, remove 1 damage counter from Root Fossil.

cards.name: Multi Energy
text: Attach Multi Energy to 1 of your Pokémon. While in play, Multi Energy provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. (Has no effect other than providing Energy.) Multi Energy provides Colorless Energy when attached to a Pokémon that already has Special Energy cards attached to it.

cards.name: Gyarados Star δ
text: You can't put more than 1 Pokémon Star in your deck.

attacks.name: Spiral Growth
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, search your discard pile for a basic Energy card and attach it to Gyarados Star.

attacks.name: All-out Blast
attacks.text: Discard cards from the top of your deck until you have 1 card left. This attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage for each Energy card you discarded in this way.

cards.name: Holon Fossil
text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for an Omanyte, Kabuto, Aerodactyl, Aerodactyl ex, Lileep, or Anorith and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. If tails, put an Omanyte, Kabuto, Aerodactyl, Aerodactyl ex, Lileep, or Anorith from your hand onto your Bench. Treat the new Benched Pokémon as a Basic Pokémon.

ability.name: Dual Aura (Duaru oora)
ability.text: As long as you have Latias or Latias ex in play, each player's Evolved Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex) can't use any Poké-Bodies.

attacks.name: Aqua Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Water Energy attached to Latios.

attacks.name: Zzzap
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Pokémon that has any Poké-Powers or Poké-Bodies (both yours and your opponent's). Don't apply Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Metallic Thunder
attacks.text: You may discard 2 Metal Energy attached to Raichu. If you do, this attack's base damage is 90 instead of 50.

ability.name: Hydro Barrier
ability.text: As long as Rayquaza has any Holon Energy cards attached to it, each of your Water Pokémon has no Weakness.

attacks.name: Delta Search
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Holon Energy card and attach it to Rayquaza. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Surprise
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at the card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Vital Drain
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Knocked Out by this attack, remove all Special Conditions and 7 damage counters from Kabutops (all if there are less than 7).

attacks.name: Thunderous Blow
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Lightning Energy attached to Kabutops.

attacks.name: Sweet Scent
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Wreck
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage. Discard that Stadium card.

attacks.name: Flames of Rage
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to Primeape. This attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage for each damage counter on Primeape.

attacks.name: Knock Away
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Paralyzing Gaze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Knock Off
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it.

cards.name: Darkness Energy
text: If the Pokémon Darkness Energy is attached to attacks, the attack does 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). Ignore this effect unless the Attacking Pokémon is Darkness or has Dark in its name. Darkness Energy provides Darkness Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Holon Adventurer
text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Discard a card from your hand. If you can't discard a card from your hand, you can't play this card. Draw 3 cards. If you discarded a Pokémon that has δ on its card, draw 4 cards instead.

attacks.name: Grind
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the amount of Energy attached to Torkoal.

ability.name: Clear Body

attacks.text: If any Stadium card with Holon in its name is in play, draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Blot
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Oddish.

cards.name: Metal Energy
text: Damage done by attacks to the Pokémon that Metal Energy is attached to is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). Ignore this effect if the Pokémon that Metal Energy is attached to isn't Metal. Metal Energy provides Metal Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

ability.name: Form Change
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Deoxys and switch it with Deoxys. (Any cards attached to Deoxys, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Deoxys on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Form Change Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Energy Loop
attacks.text: Return 2 Energy attached to Deoxys to your hand.

ability.name: Form Change
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Deoxys and switch it with Deoxys. (Any cards attached to Deoxys, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Deoxys on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Form Change Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Delta Reduction
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Deoxys by attacks is reduced by 30 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

ability.name: Form Change
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Deoxys and switch it with Deoxys. (Any cards attached to Deoxys, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Deoxys on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Form Change Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Crystal Laser
attacks.text: During your next turn, Deoxys's attacks do 40 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

ability.name: Form Change
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Deoxys and switch it with Deoxys. (Any cards attached to Deoxys, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Deoxys on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Form Change Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.text: Switch Deoxys with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

ability.name: Delta Reserve
ability.text: As long as Pidgeot has any Holon Energy cards attached to it, each player's Pokémon (excluding Pokémon that has δ on its card) can't use any Poké-Powers.

attacks.name: Rotating Claws

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Knock Away
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

ability.name: Primal Light
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Aerodactyl is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Granite Head

attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Take Down

attacks.name: Delta Circle

attacks.name: Split Bomb

ability.name: Delta Block
ability.text: As long as any Stadium card with Holon in its name is in play, your opponent can't play any Stadium cards from his or her hand.

attacks.name: Mind Play
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at the card you chose. If that card is a Trainer card, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage, and discard that card. If that card is not a Trainer card, return it to your opponent's hand.

cards.name: Holon's Castform
text: You may attach this as an Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon that already has an Energy card attached to it. When you attach this card, return an Energy card attached to that Pokémon to your hand. While attached, this card is a Special Energy card and provides every type of Energy but provides 2 Energy at a time. (Has no effect other than providing Energy.)

attacks.name: Delta Draw
attacks.text: Count the number of Pokémon you have in play that has δ on its card. Draw up to that many cards.

attacks.name: Plasma
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to Manectric.

attacks.name: Retaliate

attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Holon Lake
text: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.
Each player's Pokémon that has δ on its card can use attacks on this card instead of its own.

cards.name: Claw Fossil
text: Play Claw Fossil as if it were a Basic Pokémon. While in play, Claw Fossil counts as a Colorless Pokémon (as well as a Trainer card). Claw Fossil has no attacks of its own, can't retreat, and can't be affected by any Special Conditions. If Claw Fossil is Knocked Out, it doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon. (Discard it anyway.) At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Claw Fossil from play.
If Claw Fossil is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Claw Fossil is Knocked Out), put 1 damage counter on the Attacking Pokémon.

cards.name: δ Rainbow Energy
text: δ Rainbow Energy provides Colorless Energy. While attached to a Pokémon that has δ on its card, δ Rainbow Energy provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. (Has no effect other than providing Energy.)

cards.name: Mew ex

ability.name: Psychic Vision
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Mew ex is on your Bench, you may look at your opponent's hand.

text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Devo Crush
attacks.text: You may discard 2 Energy attached to Mew ex. If you do, you may remove the highest Stage Evolution card from the Defending Pokémon and shuffle that card into your opponent's deck.

cards.name: Mewtwo Star
text: You can't have more than 1 Pokémon Star in your deck.

attacks.name: Energy Absorption
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for an Energy card and attach it to Mewtwo Star.

attacks.name: Psychic Star
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is an Evolved Pokémon, discard all Energy attached to Mewtwo Star and this attack does 50 damage plus 50 more damage.

cards.name: Pikachu Star
text: You can't have more than 1 Pokémon Star in your deck.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Spring Back
attacks.text: If your opponent has only 1 Prize card left, this attack does 20 damage plus 50 more damage.

attacks.name: Super Psywave
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Count the amount of Energy attached to that Pokémon. Put that many damage counters on the Pokémon.
